title: [Hale Hall]
description: The polished river rock floor reflects the soft moonlight that filters in through the windows high above in the dome roof.  A few woven lauhala mats are scattered about in place of furniture.  Intricately braided coconut fiber wraps around the two supporting pillars in the middle of the room.

The polished river rock floor reflects the sunlight steaming in from the windows high above in the dome roof.  A few woven lauhala mats are scattered about in place of furniture.  Intricately braided coconut fiber wraps around the two supporting pillars in the middle of the room.

Polished river rocks spread across the floor, their rounded edges illuminated by the sunlight that pours in through the windows located high above in the domed ceiling.  Pillars crafted in the semblance of bamboo poles rise from the teak flooring, to create arches that lead north and east, while a set of double oak doors occupies the western wall.
